授業目的:
Through the profound comprehension of the “Industrial Policy” implemented by the　European Committee and the member countries of BU, we will reach more profound comprehension on this controversial policy. The important argument is based on political preference between social and/or liberal model of capitalism such as policies seeking social equity or justice and/or toward the free market system or full competition economic system.
We will read carefully the books published recently on the new industrial policies arguments just for highlighting the new arguments on the importance of what is called “Industrial Policy”. The economists ask themselves if this controversial policy would be swelled up in the long period stagnation of the EU economy. We learn also the System of National Account (SNA), especially the Input-Output Table Analysis, to understand the statistical base of Industrial Policy.
到達目標: The students are invited to attain a plain sense of supply-side economic policy and of governmental intervention called “industrial policy”.  A way of self-learning through the reading of referenced economic materials will be appreciated.
特記事項:
この科目は、10/10（月・祝）までの授業をオンデマンドで実施します。履修者確定後、履修者数が教室定員内であれば対面授業となり、教室定員を超えているとオンライン授業となります。なお、対面授業の場合は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”とはなりませんが、オンライン授業の場合は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”となりますので、60単位を超えて卒業に必要な単位として算入することができません（60単位までしか算入できない）。なお、履修者確定後、10/11（火）以降の授業形態を履修者へお知らせします。
The course will be offered on-demand until Monday, October 10 (holiday). If the finalized number of registered students is within the capacity of the classroom, the face-to-face class will be offered, and if it exceeds the capacity, the class will be online. The face-to-face course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses, while the online course is subject to the limit and cannot be included as part of the credits required for graduation beyond 60 credits (only up to 60 credits can be counted). After the registered students are confirmed, we will notify the students of the course implementation format from Tuesday, October 11 onward.
授業方法:
"On-demand" for the 1st to 3rd session.
When the number of registered students is finalized and the classroom environment standards are met, the class will be held face-to-face.
If the standards are not met, the course will continue to be offered in an on-demand format for health and safety reasons.

The first day's On-demand lecture will be uploaded at the One-Drive system and/or LUNA system for those who are interested in this lecture.
Please download files such as PowerPoint lecture PDF files and some video files that are distributed from LUNA and/or One Drive. In addition, the exercises will be prepared and you are invited to submit your answer by the midnight of the next day of every week lecture. Your attendance will be confirmed by having received your exercise answer by myself.
You may send your proper question or memo-report on the contents of the lecture whenever you will.

第1回:
"On-demand" for the 1st to 3rd session.
Introduction of the Industrial Policy in the EU and the political arguments.
The first part: What is “Industrial Policy” or “Industry Policy"?
A Political Economy Perspective by James A. Robinson.
What is an industry? An industry activity is described by Leontief linear type production function.
Introduction of Meso-economics and Input-Output Analysis.
References:
Adam A. Ambroziak, The New Industrial Policy of the European Union, Springer, 2017
Franco Mosconi, The New European Industrial Policy, Routledge, 2015

The first day's On-demand lecture will be uploaded at the One-Drive system and/or LUNA system for those who are interested in this lecture.
Please download files such as PowerPoint lecture PDF files and some video files that are distributed from LUNA and/or One Drive. In addition, the exercises will be prepared and you are invited to submit your answer by the midnight of the next day of the every week lecture. Your attendance will be confirmed by having received your exercise answer by myself.
第2回:
"On-demand" for the 1st to 3rd session.
Introduction of the Industrial Policy in the EU and the political arguments.
The second part: Historical and theoretical arguments on the Industrial Policy.
Post-war reconstruction period, Coal, Steel, and the Rebirth of Europe, Atomic energy or fossil fuels? Brief History of Nuclear Power in France, ECSC, Euratom and CERN.
References:
John Gillingham, "Coal, Steel, and the rebirth of Europe, 1945-1955".
Luca Guzetti, "A Brief History of European Union Rsearch Policy".
Thomas C. Lawton Editor, European Industrial Policy and Competitiveness, Macmillan Press, 1999
第3回:
"On-demand" for the 1st to 3rd session.
Industrial Trade Policy(1/2), Origin of the trade policy of the EU, Towards a genuine single market.
Origin of the trade policy of the EU, USA protests a violation of ESCS to GATT, European Fortress against the globalization.
References: Alfred Marshall, "Principles of Economics" (1890)
John Gillingham, "Coal, Steel, and the rebirth of Europe, 1945-1955".
Adam A. Ambroziak, The New Industrial Policy of the European
第4回:
Industrial Trade Policy(2/2), Historical and theoretical arguments on Industrial Trade Policy.
Historical and theoretical arguments on Industrial Trade Policy.
What is the difference between domestic trade and external trade in market theory?
Mercantilism.
Free Trade Appraisal, Benefit of free-trade and its institution.
Markets and transportation, The range of market price.
References: Alfred Marshall, "Principles of Economics”(1890), "The range of industrial policy".
Adam A. Ambroziak, The New Industrial Policy of the European Union, Springer, 2017
Franco Mosconi, The New European Industrial Policy, Routledge, 2015
第5回:
Common Commercial Policy (CCP) of the EU (1/2)
What is a Common Commercial Policy?
Legal Framework for the CCP. Competitiveness of EU Manufacturing. Capitalism against Capitalism.
To boost manufacturing sector needs a long-term approach of the Industrial Policy.
Comparative Advantages (RCA) in Manufacturing.
References:
Adam A. Ambroziak, "The New Industrial Policy of the European Union", Springer, 2017
Franco Mosconi, "The New European Industrial Policy", Routledge, 2015
Justina Gustyn,“Towards Competitiveness of EU Manufacturing" in the above mentioned Ambroziak book. etc.
第6回:
Common Commercial Policy (CCP) of the EU (2/2)
Positive or negative adjustment policy. Government intervention to science and technology field.
The range of industrial policy (by Marshall)
References:
Adam A. Ambroziak, editor, "The New Industrial Policy of the European Union".
“International Trade and Technical Change” by Posner.
“Positive Adjustment Policies" by OECD 1983.
INTERNATIONAL TRADE AND TECHNICAL CHANGE | Oxford Economic Papers | Oxford Academic (oup.com)
and th original materials are distributed in the class.
第7回:
Government Intervention, Anti-Monopolistic Policy.
COMPETITION Policy in the EU, SERVICES OF GENERAL ECONOMIC INTEREST.
EU Competition Rules: promoting and policing the Internal Market. by Wolf Sauter.
The Instruments of competition policy. Public interest exceptions. ANTITRUST CONTROL.
References:
Wolf Sauter, “EU Competition Rules” p.49 in Lawton’s book “Eu_Ind_Plcy_&_Cmptitivness”, Macmillan Press Ltd, 1999
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/summary/glossary/antitrust.html
Dani Rodrik, Arvind Subramanian, Francesco Trebbi, “Institutions Rule: The Primacy of Institutions Over Geography and Integration in Economic Development”, Journal of Economic Growth, 9, 131-165, 2004
Alexis Jacquemin, Charles Berry, “Entropy Measure of diversification and corporate growth., Journal of Industrial Economics, 1979, vol. 27, issue 4, 359-69
CEPII (2004), European industry's place in the International Division of Labour: situation and prospects.
第8回:
Positive Industrial Policy, theory and practices.
Conductive to Economic Growth and Positive Adjustment, Negative International Side Effects.
A New Interventionism in Response to a New Climate for Industry.
Information and Guidance Regarding Long-term Structural Change.
References:
"Positive Adjustment Policies (OECD 1983)" and th original materials are distributed in the class.
第9回:
R&D policy in the EU in late 1980s and the role of JRC.
Prolog of ESPRIT project, Information Technologies Task Force (ITTF), Precompetitive or prenormative R&D in the EU.
Pilot phase of ESPRIT. Positive effects of large-scale R&D project. less rigorous interpretation of the "precompetion"
Three beneficial effects of ESPRIT. Criticisms of the ESPRIT programme. Fortress Europe.
THE FIRST FRAMEWORK PROGRAMME. The role of Joint Research Centre (JRC).
References: Luca GUZZETTI’s “Chapter 3: High Technology and the Framework Programme” in the “A brief History of EU Research Policy” published in 1995 by European Commission.
Krzysztof Falkowski, The Industrial Sector in the European Union, in Adam A. Ambroziak, editor, "The New Industrial Policy of the European Union"
第10回:
National Accounts & IO Tables (1/2). Supply and Use table and Input-Output Table.
Specific hypotheses of the Léontief model.
The architecture of the IOT.
References: original materials are distributed in the class.
第11回:
National Accounts & IO Tables (2/2), Cost Analysis and Forecasting production by branch.
Mesoanalysis of production.
Networks of the activities of industry.
Theoretical analysis of industries.
Case of UN, OECD, EU and Japan.
References: original materials are distributed in the class.
第12回:
The standardization procedure
Joint Initiative on Standardisation in the EU. European standardisation system.
The TBT Agreement. ECONOMIC ASPECTS OF STANDARDS IN THE EU.
References: original materials are distributed in the class.
第13回:
Making Europe's businesses future-ready, Comparison of Industrial Policy in the EU and Japan.
An intellectual property action plan to support the EU's recovery and resilience.
A new Industrial Strategy for a green and digital Europe.
Comparison of the Industrial Policy between the EU and Japan.
Reference: Making the most of the EU’s innovative potential COM(2020) 760 final, A New Industrial Strategy for Europe COM(2020) 102 final and original materials are distributed in the class.
第14回:
Vision policy of Industrial Policy, The Future of EU Economy and Society.
References: European Commission, "White Paper on the Future of Europe", (2017), etc.
第15回: Summary lecture: New Industrial Policy in the EU and members policies.
